alert.note: Alert for Davidson; Williamson (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 23 at 8:57PM CST until February 24 at 6:00AM CST by NWS Nashville
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Tennessee... Harpeth River At Bellevue affecting Williamson and Davidson Counties. For the Harpeth River...including Bellevue...elevated river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Harpeth River At Bellevue. * WHEN...Until tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 16.0 feet, Portions of the Harpeth River Greenway may be covered with water and impassable, and the access road and the parking lot to the Harpeth River State Park are completely inundated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:30 PM CST Wednesday the stage was 16.1 feet and falling. - Forecast...The river is expected to continue falling through tomorrow. - Action stage is 14.0 feet. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Thursday morning at 600 AM CST.
